title: BMW mounts curb before ploughing into teenage girl in 'hit-and-run' | London Evening Standard
text:
Mourinho: My Chelsea exit was 'peanuts' compared to Ranieri sacking 
CCTV footage has been released showing the sickening moment a motorist appeared to mount the curb, ploughing into a 17-year-old girl before driving off. 
The video, released by West Midlands Police, shows the girl and her mother walking down a road in central Birmingham last month. 
Police said the teenager suffered grave neck and head injuries and was rushed to hospital where she remains in a serious condition. 
Footage shows the mother and daughter glancing into shop windows on Bromsgrove Street as they returned from a shopping trip at around 6.30pm on January 28. The BMW mounted the curb before ploughing into the teenager (West Midlands Police) 
In the background a BMW 5 series indicates that it wants to turn right before swinging around and mounting the pavement. 
The motorist then continues and appears to plough straight into the 17-year-old who is thrown to the ground. 
The car then accelerates off in what police claim is a hit-and-run. 
Footage then shows the mother rush to her daughter’s side before glancing up at the car speeding away. Woman arrested after 'hit-and-run' leaves man fighting for his life 
Police officers are appealing for witnesses in the hope of tracing the vehicle. 
PC Mark Nicholson from the force traffic unit, said: “A teenager suffered serious neck and head injuries and is still in shock from what happened. 
“I would urge anyone with information to call us and I want to appeal directly to the driver to do the right thing and come forward."
